question: 直行
sourceMnemonic:
If you think about <kanji>direct</kanji> <kanji>go</kanji>ing (aka transportation) how would you make it better? You'd make it so everything was <vocabulary>nonstop</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>direct</vocabulary>. Just imagine how much nicer it would be if every airplane you took was direct and you never had to stop. So nice!

Note <ja>直行</ja> is commonly used in business settings to describe traveling directly to a destination without making any stops, like visiting a client’s office straight from your home.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word and uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. The <ja>ちょく</ja> of <ja>直</ja> is shortened with a small <ja>っ</ja>, though, so make sure to take note of that.
